page.title: 15 A Stained Glass Memorial
page.content: On one of the windows in the main part of St. James the Apostle Church was a stained glass picture of an aeroplane. This was very colourful. Underneath was written the words :- "This window is dedicated before God in remembrance of those who gave their lives for freedom during World War II while serving at Grafton Underwood 1943-45; especially those memories of the 384th bomb group (H) The United States 8th Air Force. - Coming Home !" This is linked with the memorial statue mentioned on Page 12. At the back of the church are books for sale and a visitors book dating from 1928, containing interesting comments from people all over Britain and North America.
